title: Descriptions
content:
Normal distribution- Distributed around a central value w/no bias left or right. 
Spread- Standard deviation is a typical measure of the spread data. 
Standard Deviation- Is the square root of the variance. So the variance is the average of the square differences from the Mean.  
F-Statistic- Yields a probability(p-value) that differences are due to chance. F= (between group variability)/ (Within group variability).
